column6: Chief Executive with overall responsibility for running English Heritage on a day to day basis in conjunction with the other members of the Executive Board.
column7: Department for Culture, Media and Sport
column19: Not a Civil Servant.  English Heritage Band CE equates approximately to SCS3

column5: Director of Heritage Protection and Planning
column6: The head of Heritage Protection and Planning,  reporting to the Chief Executive.   Responsible for heritage protection, advising on making and managing changes to historic properties and publishing the annual Properties st Risk Register.
column7: Department for Culture, Media and Sport
column19: Not a Civil Servant.  English Heritage Band 1 equates approximately to SCS2

column5: Director of National Advice and Information
column6: The head of The National Advice and Information Group reporting to the Chief Executive.   Responsible for advising government and other bodies of the value of our historic environment. Includes national advice, communications, legal services and corpororate governance.
column7: Department for Culture, Media and Sport
column19: Not a Civil Servant.  English Heritage Band 1 equates approximately to SCS2

column6: The head of the National Collections Group, reporting to the Chief Executive.   Responsible for all the national heritage collections which are looked after by English Heritage, including over 400 historic properties and monuments and the National Monuments Record.
column7: Department for Culture, Media and Sport
column19: Not a Civil Servant.  English Heritage Band 1 equates approximately to SCS2

column6: The head of The Resources Group, reporting to the Chief Executive.  Responsible for providing a range of services to the organisation including finance and procurement, human resources and information management and technology.
column7: Department for Culture, Media and Sport
column19: Not a Civil Servant.  English Heritage Band 1 equates approximately to SCS2

column6: The head of the Designation Department responsible for deploying designation as a means of protection on accordance with the National Heritage Protection Plan, ensuring EH's statutory role is fulfilled and to maintain the national historic environment datasets.
column7: Department for Culture, Media and Sport
column19: Not a Civil Servant.  English Heritage Band 2 equates approximately to SCS1

column6: Head of the Heritage Protection Department, responsible for managing the development, central co-ordination of and reporting on the National Heritage Protection Plan on behalf of EH and the sector and developing sector-wide participation in its implementation.
column7: Department for Culture, Media and Sport
column19: Not a Civil Servant.  English Heritage Band 2 equates approximately to SCS1

column6: The head of the National Planning Department, responsible for providing expert input and advice in support of the National Heritage Protection Plan, to manage the EH Grant Programme and to build and maintain links with Local Authorities and other key stakeholders and organisations.
column7: Department for Culture, Media and Sport
column19: Not a Civil Servant.  English Heritage Band 2 equates approximately to SCS1

column6: The head of Corporate Communications responsible for ensuring that the sector, public and professional audiences are able to benefit directly from EH knowledge and expertise
